result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Richard Gilliland

records.addlTxt: 2:58 PM Defendant Michael Richard Gilliland in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Michael Richard Gilliland.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF82, 22CF110, 22TR1266, 22TR943 and 22TR711 heard at this time. ADA Walker: guilty to 22TR943 w/forfeiture of $811.50, AODA and 6 months revocation of DL. Dismiss 22TR711 and 22TR1266. Guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF82 with a 1 year DJOC, dismiss Ct#2-3 and 22CF110. Atty Nelson and def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Defendant pleas guilty to 22TR943 and Ct#1 in 22CF82. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant understands his right to have an attorney on 22TR943 Court finds Defendant guilty of 22TR943 and Ct#1 in 22CF82. Court dismisses 22TR711, 22TR1266, Ct#2-3 in 22CF82 and 22CF110.ADA Walker and Atty Nelson address sentencing. Court orders on 22TR943: $811.50 forfeiture due in 1 year, 6 months revocation of DL, and AODA, no IID requirements. Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 1 year DJOC on Ct#1 in 22CF82. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. Defendant to remain until he has a signed copy of the DJOC.  3:15
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

1:46 PM Defendant Michael Richard Gilliland appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF110, 22CF82, 22TR711 and 22TR943 (STC). ADA Walker states they have a resolution and would like to set a plea hearing. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:49 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. ADA Walker is requesting 22TR711 and 22TR943 follow along which are set for 7/11/22. NG pleas entered. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 10:52 am.

10:36 AM Defendant Michael Richard Gilliland appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF82 and 22CF110 (PH). Court takes Judicial notice of bond in case #22CF82.   Deputy Kale Huppert. S/T. ADA Walker questions Deputy Huppert. Record reflects identification of DE on 22CF82. Cross Atty Nelson. ADA Walker asks the Court to find probable cause and bind DE over.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

04:38 PM Defendant Michael Richard Gilliland in Court with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin via phone.  Court notes FTA and questions quashing warrant and setting PH on 06/21.  ADA Walker notes Defendant requested speedy Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions Defendant, he waives speedy Preliminary Hearing.  Court quashes warrant and reschedules PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Adjourned at 4:40 PM

04:05 PM Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in Court.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PC Deputy Cale Huppert present.  State requests warrant for adjoining states.  Court authorizes and will sign upon presentation.
from Ct Comm Gavic to SPD letter " There will need to be a wavier of the speedy prelim demanded by the Defendant. JRG"
from SPD requesting the preliminary hearing be rescheduled due to having another hearing.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

3:03 PM Defendant Michael Richard Gilliland appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Shelly Tomtschik appears by phone, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin, Comm. Jorv Gavic appears by phone.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DA Hatch is requesting a $10,000.00 w/conditions of AS, no objection. Court so orders. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:14 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
